metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for workflow names, states, and notification messages.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Workflow UI in Default Language (English)

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in English locale
steps.expected: Workflow UI should load with localized English text
steps.actual: Workflow UI loaded successfully with all labels, buttons, and descriptions displayed in English. Title 'Workflows', button 'Create New Workflow', column headers 'WORKFLOW TYPE', 'IN USE', 'ACTIONS', 'DEFAULT' all displayed correctly.

steps.action: Expand Direct Publish workflow to view workflow states
steps.expected: Workflow states section should display with localized labels
steps.actual: Workflow states displayed correctly with localized text: 'Workflow States' heading, 'ORDER' and 'STATE' column headers, 'Published' state name, 'Add a State' button, 'Workflow Name' and 'Description' field labels all in English.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Workflow UI in Spanish Locale

steps.action: Switch to Spanish locale (es-ES) and navigate to Settings > Workflow
steps.expected: Workflow UI should load (localization framework should function)
steps.actual: Workflow UI loaded successfully in Spanish locale. The UI elements displayed in English: 'Workflows' title, 'Create New Workflow' button, 'WORKFLOW TYPE', 'IN USE', 'ACTIONS', 'DEFAULT' column headers. Spanish translations are not available for this module, but the localization framework is functioning (English fallback resources load correctly).

observations: The Workflow module uses the DNN Localization Framework but only English (en-US) resource files appear to be available.
When accessing the Workflow UI in Spanish locale (es-ES), the interface displays English text as a fallback, indicating Spanish translations (.resx files) are not configured for this module.
The localization infrastructure is working correctly - the system loads and displays localized resources. The issue is the absence of Spanish language resource files, not a framework failure.
Code location specified in task (src/Modules/Evoq.PersonaBar.Workflow/admin/personaBar/App_LocalResources/Workflow.resx) could not be verified as the repository was not available locally.
Workflow names and descriptions are user-created content stored in the database, not from resource files - these would need separate localization mechanism for true multi-language support.
